newsitem.title: CHILE: Chile industrial output up 3.8 pct in July - Sofofa.
newsitem.headline: Chile industrial output up 3.8 pct in July - Sofofa.

text.p: Chilean industrial production rose 3.8 percent in July over the same month last year, while sales in the industrial sector rose 3.2 percent in July, the trade group Sociedad de Fomento Fabril (Sofofa) reported.
The July rise in industrial output marked an increase of 5.3 percent with respect to June and brought the rise for the first seven months of the year to 1.9 percent.

The seven-month figure was well below over economic growth in that period and, combined with 2.1 percent drop in industrial sales in July, reflected the general slowdown in Chilean economic growth this year.

The Central Bank's restrictive monetary policies plus the dollar's slide against the peso have both taken a toll on industrial output since the second quarter, Sofofa officials said. The peso's rise reduces income for exporters while making imports more attractive.
They announced the figures at a news conference.
